author: Tonia Roddick - USGS Wisconsin Internet Mapping
purpose: External (to webpack bundling) config file for the web services documentation.
notes: for uriList[i].parameters[i] = Add 'optional: true' if parameter is optional. Add 'showMap: true' if .geojson is an availableMedia option

resources.name: Contacts
resources.description: The CONTACT resources describes the contacts (usually principle investigators) associated with a PROJECT. It includes the contact name, email, phone, and organization. Each individual contact can only be associated with a single project, but projects can be associated with multiple contacts.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all contacts.
This service returns a contact by it's ID.
This service returns a list of contacts that a project has.
This service returns a list of contacts at an organization.

resources.name: Data Host
resources.description: The DATA HOST resource describes the datasets associated with a PROJECT. It includes: the entity, person, or organization that hosts or holds the dataset; a description of the data format/management system; and the URL of the data (if available online). Each individual data host is associated with a single project.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all data hosts.
This service returns a data host by it's ID.

parameters.name: dataHostId
parameters.description: Id of the data host requested

uriList.description: This service returns a list of data hosts for a project.

resources.name: Division
resources.description: The DIVISION resource contains the secondary phrase of a organization’s name, such as a division or office (ORGANIZATION name, DIVISION name, SECTION name). A division is associated with a single organization. Multiple organizations/divisions/sections can be assigned to a single project, and multiple projects can share the same organization/division/section.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all divisions.
This service returns a division by it's ID.

resources.name: Frequency Type
resources.description: The FREQUENCY TYPE resource describes how frequently a SITE was sampled. Multiple frequencies can be assigned to a single site, and multiple sites can share the same frequency type.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all frequency types.
This service returns a frequency type by it's ID.

parameters.name: frequencyId
parameters.description: Id of the frequency type requested

uriList.description: This service returns a list of frequency types for a site.

resources.name: Keyword
resources.description: The KEYWORD resource contains data-manager-assigned custom words or phrases that pertain to a PROJECT. Multiple keywords can be assigned to a single project, and multiple projects can share the same keyword.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all keywords.
This service returns a keyword by it's ID.
This service returns a keyword object by it's term.
This service returns a list of keywords for project.

resources.name: Lake
resources.description: The LAKE resource identifies which Great Lake basin a SITE resides in. An individual site can only be assigned to one lake.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all lakes.
This service returns a lake by it's ID.
This service returns the lake that a site is at.

resources.name: Media Type
resources.description: The MEDIA resource describes what type of media was sampled or analyzed at an individual SITE. Multiple media can be assigned to a single site, and multiple sites can share the same media.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of media types.
This service returns a media type by it's ID.
This service returns a list of media types for a site.

resources.name: Monitoring Coordination Efforts
resources.description: The MONITORING COORDINATION resource identifies particular monitoring efforts or administrative groups that a PROJECT is associated with. Multiple monitoring coordination resources can be assigned to a single project, and multiple projects can share the same monitoring coordination resource.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all monitoring coordination efforts.
This service returns a monitoring coordination effort by it's ID.

parameters.name: monitorCoordId
parameters.description: Id of monitoring coordination effort requested

uriList.description: This service returns a list of monitoring coordination efforts for a project.

resources.name: Objective Type
resources.description: The OBJECTIVE resource contains phrases and terms associated with a PROJECT’s goal or purpose. Multiple objectives can be assigned to a single project, and multiple projects can share the same objective.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all objective types.
This service returns an objective type by it's ID.
This service returns a list of objective types for a project.

resources.name: Organization
resources.description: The ORGANIZATION resource contains the first (top-level) phrase of a organization’s name (ORGANIZATION name, DIVISION name, SECTION name). Organizations can exist without divisions or sections. Multiple organizations/divisions/sections can be assigned to a single project, and multiple projects can share the same organization/division/section.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all organizations.
This service returns an organization by it's ID.

resources.name: Organization System
resources.description: The ORGANIZATION SYSTEM resource is the group of a single ORGANIZATION / DIVISION / SECTION combination.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all organization systems.
This service returns an organization system by it's ID.

parameters.name: orgSystemId
parameters.description: Id of the organization system requested

uriList.description: This service returns a list of organization systems for a project.

resources.name: Parameter Type
resources.description: The PARAMETER TYPE resource describes what was sampled at a particular SITE. It includes the parameter group (physical, chemical, biological, microbiological, and toxicological) and the individual parameter name. Each parameter is only associated with one parameter group. Multiple parameters can be assigned to a single site, and multiple sites can share the same parameter.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all parameter types.
This service returns a parameter type by it's ID.
This service returns a list of parameter types for a site.
This service returns a list of parameter types within the groups specified.

parameters.name: groupNames
parameters.description: comma serated list of group names (ex: 'Physical,Chemical,Biological'

resources.name: Project Status
resources.description: The PROJECT STATUS resource describes whether a PROJECT is active or completed. Only one status can be assigned to an individual project, but multiple projects can share the same status.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all project statuses.
This service returns a project status by it's ID.
This service returns a project status for a project.

resources.name: Project Duration
resources.description: The PROJECT DURATION resource describes the length of a project. Only one duration can be assigned to an individual project, but multiple projects can share the same duration.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all project durations.
This service returns a project duration by it's ID.
This service returns a project duration for a project.

resources.name: Project
resources.description: The PROJECT resource describes the basic information about a project. It includes: name, start date, end date, project URL (if available), description of the project, additional information (open text field), creation date, and last edited date.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all projects.
This service returns a project by it's ID.
This service returns a project for a site.
This service return project for a data host.
This service returns a list of projects that this contact has contributed to.
This service returns a list of projects that have this keyword.
This service returns a list of projects with this publication.
This service returns a list of projects with this objective type.
This service returns a list of projects with this monitoring coordination effort.

parameters.name: monitorCoordId
parameters.description: Id of the monitoring coordination effort

uriList.description: This service returns a list of projects where any of the project's sites has this frequency type.
This service returns a list of projects where any of the project's sites has this lake.
This service returns a list of projects where any of the project's sites has this media type.
This service returns a list of projects where any of the project's sites has this parameter type.
This service returns a list of projects where any of the project's sites has this resource type.
This service returns a list of projects where any of the project's sites has this status type.
This service returns a list of projects with this organization.
This service returns a list of projects with this duration.
This service returns a list of projects with this status.
This service returns a list of projects that are either flagged or not flagged (ready to show on the sigl public map) based on the boolean passed in.

parameters.name: flagValue
parameters.description: Value of 1 will returned flagged projects, 0 will return unflagged projects

uriList.description: This service returns a custom project list that contains the count of how many sites each project has and the data manager's name.

This service returns a custom project object (containing the project as well as project objectives, keywords, data hosts, organizations, contacts, and publications) by the science base id or by a project id.

parameters.name: scienceBaseId
parameters.description: science base id if this project is from science base

resources.name: Publication
resources.description: The PUBLICATION resource describes the publications associated with a PROJECT. It includes the publication title, description, and online publication URL (if one exists). Each individual publication is associated with a single project.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all publications.
This service returns a publication by it's ID.
This service return a list of publications for a project.

resources.name: Resource Type
resources.description: The RESOURCE TYPE resource describes where samples were taken at an individual SITE. Multiple resource types can be assigned to a single site, and multiple sites can share the same resource type.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all resource types.
This service returns a resource type by it's ID.
This service returns a list of resource types for a site.

resources.name: Role
resources.description: The ROLE resource describes the type of access an individual Data Manager has within the SiGL DMS.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of roles.
This service returns a role by it's ID.

resources.name: Section
resources.description: The SECTION resource contains the tertiary phrase of a organization’s name, such as a division or office (ORGANIZATION name, DIVISION name, SECTION name). A section is associated with a single organization/division combination. Multiple organizations/divisions/sections can be assigned to a single project, and multiple projects can share the same organization/division/section.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all sections.
This service returns a section by it's ID.

resources.name: Site
resources.description: The SITE resource describes the basic information about a site. It includes: name, description, latitude, longitude, country, state, latitude, longitude, site description, waterbody, HUC8, sampling start date, sampling end date, sampling platform, site URL (if available), and additional information (open text field). Each individual site can only be associated with a single project, but projects can be associated with multiple sites.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of sites.
This service returns a site by it's ID.
This service returns a custom site object that contains the site as well as it's resources, media, frequencies, and parameters.
This service returns a list of sites for a project.
This service returns a list of custom site objects that contains the site as well as it's resources, media, frequencies, and parameters.
This service returns a list of sites at this lake.
This service returns a list of sites with this status.
This service returns a list of sites with this media.
This service returns a list of sites with this resource type.
This service returns a list of sites with this parameter type.
This service returns a list of sites with this frequency type.
This service returns a list of sites that meet the passed-in values.

parameters.name: durationIDs
parameters.description: comma separated list of project duration IDs (ex: 1,2,3)

parameters.name: lakeIDs
parameters.description: comma separated list of lake IDs

parameters.name: mediaIDs
parameters.description: comma separated list of media type IDs

parameters.name: objIDs
parameters.description: comma separated list of objective type IDs

parameters.name: monCoordIDs
parameters.description: comma separated list of monitoring coordination effort IDs

parameters.name: orgID
parameters.description: organization ID that created the project that this site belongs to

parameters.name: parameterIDs
parameters.description: comma separated list of parameter type IDs

parameters.name: resCompIDs
parameters.description: comma separated list of resource type IDs

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: comma separated list of state names (ex: 'Michigan,Wisconsin')

parameters.name: statusIDs
parameters.description: comma separated list of project status IDs

resources.name: Site Status
resources.description: The SITE STATUS resource describes whether a SITE is currently being sampled (active) or not (inactive). A site can only have one status.

uriList.description: This service returns a list of all status types.
This service returns a status type by it's ID.
This service returns the status type for a site.
